articles.title: Pot sales boom in Massachusetts, but some residents fume over traffic
articles.description: New numbers show legal marijuana sales in Massachusetts are booming. The state's two pot shops reported more than $2.2 million in sales during their first five days of business. They've sold more than 56,000 marijuana products. Tony Dokoupil reports.

articles.title: Paul Manafort denies meeting with WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange
articles.description: Former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort is strongly denying any connection with WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. Manafort reportedly had secret meetings with Assange before WikiLeaks published emails from Hillary Clinton's campaign. Paula Reid reports.

articles.title: Paradise High School athletes play first basketball game since deadly Camp Fire

articles.title: Trump lashes out at GM over planned layoffs
articles.description: General Motors will lay off up to 14,000 workers in North America and consider closing up to five major plants. The news did not go over well with President Trump, who took to Twitter to voice his disappointment. CBS News correspondent Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.title: 3 U.S. service members killed in Afghanistan
articles.description: A roadside bombing in Afghanistan left three American service members dead. The bombing took place in the Ghazni province, where U.S. forces have battled the Taliban for months. CBS News foreign correspondent Charlie D'Agata reports.

articles.title: Mississippi Senate race could make history

articles.title: Florida man recalls near-death hang gliding experience caught on video
articles.description: A Florida man is sharing what it was like to hold on to a hang glider while desperately trying not to fall. He clung to life 4,000 feet in the air for more than two minutes. CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez has his story.
